Class FileSystemSecurityRealm

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.wildfly.security.auth.provider.FileSystemSecurityRealm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:

    public final class FileSystemSecurityRealm
extends Object
implements ModifiableSecurityRealm
    A simple filesystem-backed security realm.
    Author:
    David M. Lloyd

    • Method Detail

      • createRealmIdentity

        public ModifiableRealmIdentity createRealmIdentity(String name)
        Description copied from interface: ModifiableSecurityRealm
        For the given name create the RealmIdentity in the context of this security realm. Any validation / name mapping is an implementation detail for the realm.

        A realm returning a RealmIdentity does not confirm the existence of an identity, a realm may also return null from this method if the provided {code name} can not be mapped to an identity although this is not required of the realm.

        Specified by:
        createRealmIdentity in interface ModifiableSecurityRealm
        Specified by:
        createRealmIdentity in interface SecurityRealm
        Parameters:
        name - the name to use when creating the RealmIdentity
        Returns:
        the RealmIdentity for the provided name or null

      • getRealmIdentityIterator

        public Iterator<ModifiableRealmIdentity> getRealmIdentityIterator()
                                                           throws RealmUnavailableException
        Description copied from interface: ModifiableSecurityRealm
        Get an iterator over all of this realm's identities.
        Specified by:
        getRealmIdentityIterator in interface ModifiableSecurityRealm
        Returns:
        the identity iterator
        Throws:
        RealmUnavailableException - if the realm fails for some reason

      • getCredentialAcquireSupport

        public SupportLevel getCredentialAcquireSupport(String credentialName)
                                         throws RealmUnavailableException
        Description copied from interface: SecurityRealm
        Determine whether a given credential is definitely obtainable, possibly obtainable (for some identities), or definitely not obtainable.
        Specified by:
        getCredentialAcquireSupport in interface SecurityRealm
        Parameters:
        credentialName - the credential name
        Returns:
        the level of support for this named credential
        Throws:
        RealmUnavailableException - if the realm is not able to handle requests for any reason
